title: Trainsignal - Windows Server 2008 R2 Virtualization (70-659)

With this course you'll learn how to effectively use Hyper-V and Systems Center Virtual Machine Manager (VMM). You'll learn to consolidate multiple physical servers on a single host, and you'll get an overview of high availability, clustering, and migration.
Lesson 0: Getting Started with Microsoft Server Virtualization Training
Lesson 1: Lab Setup
Lesson 2: The Course Scenario
Lesson 3: Introduction to Microsoft Virtualization and Virtualization Management
Lesson 4: Installing the Hyper-V Role on Windows Server 2008 R2
Lesson 5: Working with Virtual Hard Disks and Virtual Machines
Lesson 6: Introduction to System Center Virtual Machine Manager 2008 R2
Lesson 7: Installing System Center Virtual Machine Manager 2008 R2
Lesson 8: Managing Hosts in Virtual Machine Manager 2008 R2
Lesson 9: Managing VMs in Virtual Machine Manager 2008 R2
Lesson 10: Performing Physical-to-Virtual Conversion
Lesson 11: Performing Virtual-to-Virtual Conversion
Lesson 12: Virtual Machine Manager Library
Lesson 13: Installing the VMM Self-Service Portal
Lesson 14: Overview of Remote Desktop Services (RDS)
Lesson 15: Configuring Remote Desktop Services Load Balancing
Lesson 16: Configuring RemoteApp
Lesson 17: Configuring Remote Desktop Gateway
Lesson 18: Configuring Remote Desktop Services Client Connections
Lesson 19: Configuring the Offline Virtual Machine Servicing Tool
Lesson 20: Virtual Machine Backup and Recovery
Lesson 21: Monitoring Virtualization
Lesson 22: Implementing High Availability for Server Virtualization
Lesson 23: Preparing for Your Windows Server 2008 R2, Server Virtualization (70-659) Certification Exam
Lesson 24: Next Steps
